unnormalised: **Automotive Sector Gears Up with New Vehicle Launches**
normalised: **Automotive Sector Gears Up with New Vehicle Launches**

unnormalised: The Indian automotive market is witnessing a flurry of activity with several new vehicle launches across different segments. Dr. APJ Abdul Kalam Technological University recently hosted a seminar on the future of electric vehicles, coinciding with Tata Motors unveiling their latest EV offering, the 'Indica EV 2.0', promising a range of 400 km on a single charge.
normalised: The Indian automotive market is witnessing a flurry of activity with several new vehicle launches across different segments. Doctor A P J Abdul Kalam Technological University recently hosted a seminar on the future of electric vehicles, coinciding with Tata Motors unveiling their latest E V offering, the 'Indica E V two point zero', promising a range of four hundred kilometer on a single charge.

unnormalised: Maruti Suzuki is reportedly launching a CNG variant of the popular 'Brezza' compact SUV, aiming to cater to budget-conscious buyers. Meanwhile, Mahindra & Mahindra teased the 'Scorpio-N Adventure Edition', expected to feature enhanced off-road capabilities.
normalised: Maruti Suzuki is reportedly launching a C N G variant of the popular 'Brezza' compact S U V, aiming to cater to budget-conscious buyers. Meanwhile, Mahindra and Mahindra teased the 'Scorpio-N Adventure Edition', expected to feature enhanced off-road capabilities.

unnormalised: These launches are poised to intensify competition in the market. Industry analysts predict a boost in sales figures, especially during the upcoming Diwali season. The new offerings span from affordable commuters to premium SUVs, reflecting the diverse needs of Indian consumers. The average showroom size for new dealerships is estimated to be 5,000 sq ft. Prices for these vehicles range from Rs. 6 Lakhs to Rs. 25 Lakhs, depending on the model and features.
normalised: These launches are poised to intensify competition in the market. Industry analysts predict a boost in sales figures, especially during the upcoming Diwali season. The new offerings span from affordable commuters to premium S U Vs, reflecting the diverse needs of Indian consumers. The average showroom size for new dealerships is estimated to be five thousand square feet. Prices for these vehicles range from rupee six lakhs to rupee twenty five lakhs, depending on the model and features.
